description: Inherited from Middle English enamoured, a partial calque of Old French enamore, past participle of enamorer, enamourer; compare amour and enamor, enamour.

adjectives.description: enamored (comparative more enamored, superlative most enamored)

examples: She's enamored of [or with] her new boyfriend.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of enamor
